result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kashae R Brashear

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kashae R Brashear
Current: 4532 N. 46th St., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 6449 North 105Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224

Defendant Kashae R Brashear in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Kashae R Brashear.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzel in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel informed the Court this case is in deferred prosecution agreement posture. Defendant has completed a TAD evaluation.
Defense is requesting a DPA hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kashae R Brashear appeared by phone.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Kashae R Brashear.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Case is in DPA posture, TAD evaluation has been scheduled. Defense requested a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 09/27/2022 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 bi-weekly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 12/01/2022. th
Case being rescheduled to 10/14/2022 at 8:30 per Attorney Mogren's request. Attorney Mogren to contact defendant. All parties notified.

Defendant Kashae R Brashear in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints Joel Mogren as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Mogren accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 every two weeks, commencing 12/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/12/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Kashae R Brashear in court. Attorney Madaline Witte appeared for the State of Wisconsin under the student practice rule. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 2p
